option.page: Okay, just let me know when you're ready.
She is regarded as the worldâ€™s first novelist, writing about the court life of Heian period Japan.
Murasaki Shikibu is a pseudonym used by the writer of The Tale of Genji.
Although the author's real name is unknown, many speculate that the author may have been Fujiwara no Takako.
For the time period, a female writer would have been largely unheard of.
Despite this, we know that Murasaki Shikibu, and other ladies of the court were taught to read and write Japanese.
The Tale of Genji was most likely written for fellow members of the court to read as entertainment.
